**Announcement: "Dear, all, Kindly note the
following…"**

Joshita Yadav

Created
YesterdayYesterday (Edited Yesterday)

Dear, all,

Kindly note the
following w.r.t. the in-class quiz on Plagiarism tomorrow (18 Aug’ 23, Friday,
09:30 am):

1. Friday is a
full-working day at IIIT-D; hence if absent, there will be no allowances to
retake the missed quiz.

2. Although we will
be using Google Classroom to conduct the quiz, there will be in-class
attendance & ONLY those marked 'present' will have their quizzes graded.
Hence, your physical presence is mandatory for a valid grade. Proxy’s in
attendance & Quiz-attempt will be a straight zero for all involved.

3. Avoid spamming
the Faculty or TAs with emails last minute/late night. We have
personal-professional boundaries, and I shall be available until 5:30 pm today
(17 Aug'23, Thursday) to respond.

All The Best!

Prepare Well &
See you all (on time) tomorrow.

From
<https://classroom.google.com/c/NjE3NTEwNTkxMzEx>

**RMSSD 2023**

**Ground Rules and Regulations
for the Smooth Conduct of the Class**

**1.**

This is not high
school; you are in a professional college, enrolled in a professional degree,
so the expectation from you is that you conduct yourself professionally.

**2.**

We are a large
class, so we cannot cater to you every time in an efficient manner. Though we
strive to do this to the best of our abilities

**3.**

Given that we are a
large lecture class and move steadily, we will have to strictly enforce
deadlines and regulations to avoid chaos.

**Assignments**

**1.**

Take-home
assignments have to be submitted online through turn-it-in.

**2.**

*ChatGTP* and Wikipedia are not your best
friends, so kindly use them wisely. They may come to haunt us.

**3.**

Submissions must be
submitted on time to be accepted. For documented emergencies, kindly contact
the instructor at least 24 hours before the deadline.  No
exceptions. ONLY documented emergencies will be entertained. Permission is
not automatic.

**4.**

For every 5 minutes
of late submission, 1 point will be deducted. No exceptions.

**Plagiarism Policy: Strict Plagiarism Policy will be
followed as the IIITD Institute outlines. No exceptions.**

https://www.iiitd.ac.in/academics/resources/acad-dishonesty

**1.** 

Please follow the
APA / or ACM citation system for all the assignments submitted to the class
unless specified.

**2.**

Please submit all
the assignments through the Turnitin system to ensure we have a certified
assignment with less than 6% of plagiarism. Anyone submitting an assignment
greater than this will be subjected to the plagiarism policies outlined by the
Institute.

**3.**

In-class quizzes
have 5-10 questions that are meant to be answered in 8 minutes, with 1.5
minutes allocated to each of the questions. While nothing stops you from
referring to your notes and slides, this is meant to be done before the class
and not during the quiz. The quiz forum closes sharply after 8 minutes.
So, you have 8 minutes to complete and submit the quiz. I won’t consider any
late submissions under any circumstance. The questions are straightforward and
depend simply on listening, understanding the lecture, and revising them before
class.

**4.**

You
can submit in-class quizzes **(NOT Full-fledged proctored exercises)** by
email twice throughout the semester. No exception. I will only accept such
a submission up to two times under any circumstances. This can be done only in
exceptional conditions when you have an internet disconnection, in which case,
you can submit it through your phone in the following format.

Subject line:

- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Quiz-3 From concepts
to measurements: B,C,D,B,C | Quiz Code: XE##$

_______________________________________________________________

**This should be submitted within the stipulated time
(by the end of class time). No exceptions**

**Email and Google Classroom Communication Etiquette and
Rules**

Your emails must be
addressed politely to the individual (TAs/Faculty) and avoid informal
language.

**1.**

We do not resolve
last-minute issues by email.

**2.**

I/we do not have
email on my mobile phone, so I won’t chat with you via email and resolve issues
immediately.

**3.**

We will try to
respond to any e-mail within 24 hours.

**4.**

We do not respond to
emails after 5 pm on Friday to Monday Morning at 10 AM.

**5.**

We do not share any
information on emails provided or discussed in the class.

**6.**

If you are absent,
kindly talk to your TAs or student friends who regularly attend the class.

**7.**

If you don’t have
time to attend classes and Office Hours, we cannot resolve your issues by
email.

**8.**

TAs and Faculty are
not customer service personnel. Please don’t treat us like that.

**9.**

We do not discuss
why you got a low grade on an assignment in great detail. We have “Office
Hours” for that.

**10.**

We
give only a little feedback on assignments in the comments sections of Google
Classroom. We have “Office Hours” for that. ****

**11.**

I will make you drop
the course if you are rude to any of our TAs /TFs. Any issue can be resolved
politely.

**12.**

We
will not resolve **ANY
ISSUES that are more than two weeks old.**

**13.**

**We only accept assignments by email if we give you
prior permission for critical situations only.**

**ATTENDANCE AND In-Class Behaviour**

Coming to class and
discussion sections is MANDATORY, NOT AN OPTION. This is a hands-on class. You
are welcome to bunk classes, but I am not responsible for giving everything on
slides that cannot replace class lectures. Discussion and oral lecture content
are also part of the syllabus.

**1.**

**We will have graded assignments in the discussion
sections and classes. We can’t re-conduct them for you if you are absent.**

**2.**

My classes are not
birthday parties, so kindly don’t walk in late casually and expect us to
accommodate you. Ask permission to enter if you are late.

**3**.

We will insist on
bio-scan attendance during quizzes and exams.

**Other things:**

**1)**

You are responsible
for reading the assigned texts when advised and are free to raise any questions
in the class.

**2)**

You understand that
this class cannot only be passed by browsing through the slides and last-minute
cramming

**3)**

You will try your
best to attend the classes and engage in the conversations in the
classes.

**4)**

If you have any
concerns or feedback, it will be communicated politely, either by email or in
person during office hours.

**5)**

You will communicate
courteously with the faculty member and the TA.

**6)**

We may modify these
rules. However, we will inform you of this.

**WHAT YOU NEED TO DO:**

Kindly sign in below
as a private comment so that I know you read and understood the rules and
regulations.

KINDLY
TYPE THE FOLLOWING: “I read and understood the rules and guidelines for the
class,” AND THEN SIGN YOUR NAME- **NAME.**

e.g., “I read and
understood the rules and guidelines for the RMSSD class”-Ratan Suri

**5 points for this.**

**No points for anyone who signs after the 10th of
August. No Exceptions.**

[data:image/jpeg;base64,](data:image/jpeg;base64,)

Siddhant
BaliAug 9

I read and
understood the rules and guidelines for the RMSSD class - Siddhant Bali

From
<https://classroom.google.com/c/NjE3NTEwNTkxMzEx>

**Announcement: "Dear all, Depending on guest

Venkata Ratnadeep
Suri

Created
Aug 9Aug 9

Dear all,

Depending on guest
lecture schedules, TA lectures, class flow, and course structure, we sometimes
convert labs to classes and vice versa. So the assumption that you can bunk
labs without consequences is a misguided advice. We will continue our class
tomorrow with the topics we started today.

Best

ratan

**Announcement: "Zotero Lab Tutorials for Tomorrow
Dear…"**

Venkata Ratnadeep
Suri

Created
Aug 10Aug 10

Zotero Lab Tutorials
for Tomorrow

Dear all,

We will be beginning
our Lab tutorials tomorrow. Kindly download Zotero from Zotero.org.

Works on both Mac
and Windows versions.

If you don't plan on
working with us in the lab on your computer, kindly don't come to class and
disturb others. If you can't be productive, don't be disruptive.

Save our time
downloading it in the class; please come prepared.

best

ratan

Joshita Yadav

Created
Aug 18Aug 18

Dear All,

Please note the
following:

1.
The answer key for the first-in-class quiz (conducted on Fri, 18 Aug) will be
shared soon. We expect you to **go
through the answer key patiently.**

2. **Kindly do not spam the faculty/TAs with
emails**; we will announce our office hours before we
release your scores, and then you can come to discuss with us **during those
office hours only**.

***3. We will not be responding to
discussions of your scores/doubts about the quiz question/answer key via emails
- we have office hours particularly for these things.***

4.
At the same time, if you have some particular doubts about course
content/topic(s)/slide content, drop us an email with what you wish to discuss so that we are prepared well and can address your queries.

Have
a rested weekend, and jot down your doubts to ask ***AFTER the weekend**,*

I shall be
responding to comments here till End-of-working-day (5:30 pm, Fri 18 Aug).

From
<https://classroom.google.com/c/NjE3NTEwNTkxMzEx>

about ICQ-1 scores. Your scores are intact. There is nothing to panic. We will

(TAs and TF) and will revisit this issue next Thursday.  If your scores get

Enjoy EYSA. and Let
us enjoy a class-free weekend.

best

**Announcement: "Dear all, Today morning in
the…"**

Venkata Ratnadeep
Suri

Created
Sep 1Sep 1

Dear all,

Today morning in the
discussion section, we took attendance at the request of the Academics
Division. Based on this, we identified 55 students who attended the class and
took the exam. We will be only grading these students. Rest all will receive a
zero.

Kindly note that
attending classes and tutorials is not an option. Similarly, surprise quizzes
are meant to be taken in class under proctoring. Not from college couches,
beach resorts, and poolside setees.

Happy Weekend.

Ratan

From
<https://classroom.google.com/c/NjE3NTEwNTkxMzEx>

Venkata Ratnadeep
Suri

Created
YesterdayYesterday

Dear all,

A few students
emailed us asking if they can use other tools, shortcuts, etc. The answer is
no. This exercise was created to emulate a particular chain of activities that
constitute basic literature search, collection building, and citing from these
collections and to respond to the changing needs of the publication
cycle.

Similarly, the
submission must follow the template format and adhere to all the guidelines
outlined in the assignment.

Finally submissions
must be done through Turnitin only.

We will not grade
any assignment that does not follow the guidelines.

Best

Ratan

From
<https://classroom.google.com/c/NjE3NTEwNTkxMzEx>

**Announcement: "Dear all, Assignment - 1 (due
on…"**

Joshita Yadav

Created
Aug 31Aug 31 (Edited Yesterday)

Dear all,

**Assignment - 1 *(due on Monday, 4
September 2023, 23:59hrs)*** will be uploaded and
submitted by students on Turnitin.

These are the
Turnitin Class Details:

- Class ID: **40117686**
- Enrollment key for the class: **vk7ozna**

Note:

- We cannot entertain deadline extension requests as the due date for the assignment is unalterable on the portal.
- Only assignments submitted on Turnitin will be graded, not the ones sent via email.
- Follow this link for FAQs: https://help.turnitin.com/feedback-studio/turnitin-website/student/submitting-a-paper/file-upload-submission.htm#before-getting-started
- Our Office Hours are on this Google Classroom and can be utilized **by prior appointment only.** Email us your issues so we can be prepared.

From
<https://classroom.google.com/c/NjE3NTEwNTkxMzEx>
